pullRequest.body:
On the way to locally complete K iff complete O(K) 
Also add some helper lemmas about uniform continuity of multiplication by a constant with a variant for rings (via smul) instead of UniformGroup (which fields are not).


---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10912959527/job/30288578709)

maintainer merge
maintainer merge
I left some comments; concerning `UniformContinuous.const_mul'` it is perhaps enought to mention in the doc that both exist.

```suggestion
      replace h := norm_inv x ▸ inv_lt_one h
```

```suggestion
lemma norm_eq_one_iff_ne_zero_of_discrete {x : 𝕜} : ‖x‖ = 1 ↔ x ≠ 0 := by
```
?

Any possibility of a better name? `mul_norm_bddAbove` perhaps?

(Perhaps we need to institute a rule that theorems ending in primes need a doc-string containing the explanation for why nothing better is available. :-)
Similarly here. What is the `'` doing?

The unprimed `UniformContinuous.const_mul` is added in the PR as well. That one has the strong assumption of `UniformGroup` on the domain, while this primed version requires a totally different assumption: `UniformContinuousConstSMul R R` -- on the codomain.

How do you suggest we differentiate the two sets?

I agree that the proof needs k to be a division ring, but is it really needed mathematically?

Is it also possible to add some comments in the intro of the file about this result?

Here's a counterexample of a `NormedRing` that has `DiscreteTopology` but where nonzeros have a norm that isn't 1. The counterexample is the integers, but all the norms have been scaled by 2. This is because `norm_inv` in Mathlib requires `NormedDivisionRing`. Similarly, `norm_one` isn't true for an arbitrary `NormedRing`.

```
import Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Lemmas

def Z := ℤ
deriving DecidableEq, LinearOrderedCommRing

@[simp]
def Z.toInt (z : Z) : ℤ := z

@[simp] noncomputable def Z.norm (z : Z) : ℝ := 2 • ‖z.toInt‖

noncomputable instance : Norm Z := ⟨Z.norm⟩

noncomputable instance : NormedRing Z where
  dist x y := Z.norm (x - y)
  dist_self := by simp
  dist_comm := by simp [← dist_eq_norm, dist_comm]
  dist_triangle x y z := by
    simp only [Z.norm, Z.toInt, nsmul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat, ← mul_add]
    simpa using norm_sub_le_norm_sub_add_norm_sub _ _ _
  eq_of_dist_eq_zero := by simp [sub_eq_zero]
  dist_eq _ _ := by congr
  norm_mul x y := by
    simp only [norm, Z.norm, Z.toInt, nsmul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat, mul_assoc,
                Nat.ofNat_pos, mul_le_mul_left]
    rw [mul_left_comm, ← Real.norm_eq_abs, Int.cast_mul]
    refine (norm_mul_le _ _).trans ?_
    simp [two_mul, mul_nonneg]

@[simp] lemma norm_lt_one {z : Z} : ‖z‖ < 1 ↔ z = 0 := by
  simp only [norm, Z.norm]
  have : 2 • |(z.toInt : ℝ)| = |2 • z.toInt| := by
    simp only [Z.toInt, nsmul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat]
    rw [← Int.norm_eq_abs]
    simp only [Int.cast_abs, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_ofNat]
    rw [← Real.norm_eq_abs, norm_mul]
    simp [Int.norm_eq_abs]
  rw [this]
  norm_cast
  simp [Int.abs_lt_one_iff]

instance : DiscreteTopology Z := by
  rw [discreteTopology_iff_nhds]
  intro x
  ext y
  simp only [Metric.mem_nhds_iff, gt_iff_lt, Filter.mem_pure]
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨ε, εpos, h⟩
    exact h (by simp [εpos])
  · intro h
    use 1
    simp only [zero_lt_one, true_and]
    intro z
    simp (config := {contextual := true}) [dist_eq_norm, sub_eq_zero, h]

example {z : Z} : ‖z‖ > 1 ↔ z ≠ 0 := by
  rw [iff_not_comm, ← norm_lt_one, gt_iff_lt, not_lt, lt_iff_le_not_le]
  simp only [not_le, norm_lt_one, and_iff_left_iff_imp]
  simp only [norm, Z.norm, Nat.cast_ofNat]
  have : 2 • |(z.toInt : ℝ)| = |2 • z.toInt| := by
    simp only [Z.toInt, nsmul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat]
    rw [← Int.norm_eq_abs]
    simp only [Int.cast_abs, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_ofNat]
    rw [← Real.norm_eq_abs, norm_mul]
    simp [Int.norm_eq_abs]
  rw [this]
  norm_cast
  simp [Int.abs_le_one_iff, Int.mul_eq_one_iff_eq_one_or_neg_one,
    Int.mul_eq_neg_one_iff_eq_one_or_neg_one]
```
WOWOW! That's awesome, thanks.
Given that both in the statement and in the proof you use some non hyper-standard tools (the way you state non-triviality, and the `config` setting), adding a bit of doc would be very useful.
Both results are nice, can you add a line in the doc at the beginning of the file mentioning at least one of them?
Would it be possible to remove the Comm assumption?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Normed/Field): `completeSpace_iff_isComplete_closedBall`
